alert.note: Alert for Breathitt (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 28 at 3:19PM EDT until July 31 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Kentucky... North Fork Kentucky River at Jackson affecting Breathitt County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...North Fork Kentucky River at Jackson. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 41.3 feet, Many homes are inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 38.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:00 PM EDT Thursday was 38.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 41.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 41.3 feet on 02/02/1951. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued by 9 PM EDT.
